address: Phường Đạo Long, Thành phố Phan Rang-Tháp Chàm, Tỉnh Ninh Thuận
thought:
**My Analysis of Address Mapping**

Okay, so I'm tasked with mapping this old address: "Phường Đạo Long, Thành phố Phan Rang-Tháp Chàm, Tỉnh Ninh Thuận" to its new administrative unit. My initial thought process is straightforward: I need to pinpoint the old ward and province. In this case, it's "Phường Đạo Long" in "Tỉnh Ninh Thuận."

First, I'll dive into the province resolutions, specifically checking if "Tỉnh Ninh Thuận" underwent any mergers. Bingo! Resolution 60-NQ/TW states that Ninh Thuận was merged with Khánh Hòa, becoming "Tỉnh Khánh Hoà."

Now, I shift my focus to "Phường Đạo Long." I'll scrutinize other relevant resolutions for any mention. I quickly find Resolution 1667/NQ-UBTVQH15, which is key. It details the re-organization of administrative units in Khánh Hòa. Importantly, this resolution explicitly mentions "Đạo Long." It states that "Phường Đạo Long" (along with a few others) will be consolidated into a new ward called "**phường Phan Rang**."

Next, I cross-reference this finding with my "New Wards" data. I'm looking for details about "Phường Phan Rang." The data confirms:  `{"ward_code":"22759","ward_name":"Phường Phan Rang","province_name":"Tỉnh Khánh Hòa"}`. This perfectly aligns with the merger information I found.

Putting it all together, I conclude that "Phường Đạo Long" is now part of "Phường Phan Rang" and the province has become "Tỉnh Khánh Hoà." The fact that the resolution directly mentions "Đạo Long," paired with the clear province merger, gives me a high degree of confidence in this mapping. My final output will reflect this certainty.

citation.header: 1667/NQ-UBTVQH15: Sắp xếp các đơn vị hành chính cấp xã của tỉnh Khánh Hòa
citation.line: 60. Sắp xếp toàn bộ diện tích tự nhiên, quy mô dân số của các phường Kinh Dinh, Phủ Hà, Đài Sơn và Đạo Long thành phường mới có tên gọi là phường Phan Rang.
